page.title: 18CASTLE HILL & HOLEYN HALL
page.content: {CASTLE HILL HOUSE, WYLAM Castle Hill House was built in 1878 by A.M.Dunn for his own occupation. It was sold in 1901 to F.Sterling Newall whose sons gave the property to the R.V.I. in the 1930s, and who now use it as their country branch. (convalescent home) {HOLEYN HALL Holeyn Hall was built in 1851/52. Owners came and past on. The most famous of these was Sir Charles Parsons, inventer of the first practical steam turbine generator. During the first World War Holeyn Hall was used as a hospital and then bacame residential again. Today it is split into three flats.
